children.subject: No, some classes are only lecture. Some classes only have discussion sections (2 components), and some classes have both a discussion AND lab sections (3 components).
What does it mean for seats to be available in “every” section that a person has selected? Are we able to select more than one section?
I don't understand what you're asking. The conflict override form can only be used if you're trying to add a CS course

For students who are:

  • on the waitlist for a CS class
  • enrolled in a "locked" L&S class (i.e. instructors are not making any more changes on CalCentral) L&S class
  • enrolled L&S section and waitlisted CS lecture have a time conflict

My GSI for the L&S class suggested that the CS department override the conflict. If seats open up in the waitlisted CS lecture, is this an applicable use for the CS Override form?
There are no reserved seats for CS188: http://classes.berkeley.edu/content/2018-spring-compsci-188-001-lec-001
Is it possible that CS 188 got expanded?
How many more caps could be open for 188? When can we finalize the result of enrollment
This refers to the 70% enrollment cap we originally use for all upper divisions. For CS 188, this cap has been lifted. At this time, we don't forsee the possibility of releasing any additional seats.
What does it mean by "Once the reserve caps are removed"? Have they been removed already for all classes? If not, when will the reserve cap for CS 188 be removed?
If you stop having a time conflict, then that will no longer block you from enrolling. If there's nothing else blocking you from enrolling, then sure.

I don't get it, does this notification mean that the system is trying to enroll me, and failing because of the time conflict, or is it warning me that I won't be able to enroll because of the time conflict when a spot becomes available. I'm pretty far down the wait list(#63), so I'd be surprised if I'm getting in the class this early.
Likely the latter given your waitlist position.

I'm getting this notification for CS170, which conflicts with CS189, which I'm fully enrolled in. I plan to drop 189 if I know I can get into 170, though. The email seems to imply that I will get into the class if the time conflict is removed. Can I safely drop 189 and get into 170 if I'm getting this notification? Thanks

history.content:
If you are have a time conflict and are wait listed for a CS class, you probably are receiving notifications telling you to drop the class and re-enroll into a section that has open seats in order to get off the wait list.

What may not be clearly stated is that you will not be enrolled in the class if there are no open seats in the lecture as well. In order to move off the wait list automatically, there need to be seats available in all components of the class. Since most of the CS classes are fully enrolled, dropping and re-enrolling into a different section could have the tragic result of simply moving you to the end of the wait list!

Factors that will prevent you from being enrolled from the wait list (even if there are open seats) are:

  • if you have a time conflict with any component of the class. See the Piazza post about the CS Time Conflict Override form (post 5366)
  • if you do not have enough units available to be enrolled without going over the max unit limit of 20.5 units

Wait list FAQs

1. How does the wait list work during the adjustment period?

Once the reserve caps are removed, the wait list is processed in sequential order. Four times a day (6:40am & pm, 12:40pm & am) the system compares the maximum enrollment with the current enrollment. If there is any space available, the system them starts at the top of the wait list and attempts to enroll the first person. If that person has no time conflicts, enough units to allow enrollment and there are seats available in all sections the person has selected, then the person is enrolled. If those three conditions are not met, the person remains on the wait list and the system moves on to the next person on the list.

Why is this important? You may decide to keep your current position on the wait list instead of dropping and re-enrolling into a different section (and dropping further down the wait list). Switching sections when the lecture is full will not help you get into the class.

2. Can I see what my wait list position is for discussion and/or lab sections?

Unfortunately, no. The system only displays the wait list position for the enrollment component (lecture).

3. Can I swap for another class but keep my position on the wait list?

No, Once you are enrolled into the class, you can use the drop function. While you are wait listed, you can only drop and enroll into the other class. Allowing you to keep your hedge your bets by keeping your wait list position while attempting a swap isn't fair to people behind you on the wait list who are fully committed to getting into the class.
history.subject: Wait list processing during the adjustment period & other wait list FAQs
